title: Matter 1.2 update brings the standard to fridges, ACs, and your robo-vacuum
description: Matter 1.2 isn't currently available although certain smart home brands do plan on supporting soon.

title: Build-your-own-chip startup wants everyone to design and fab their own processor via a simple UI – but Nvidia, Intel et al needn’t worry for now
description: Zero ASIC is hoping to democratize chip design by removing key step that costs $100 million.

title: Tesla just demonstrated the bulletproof nature of its Cybertruck… by unloading a Tommy gun into one
description: Elon Musk attempts to confirm the bulletproof properties of the upcoming Cybertruck by shooting it with an automatic weapon

title: Dangerous new malware can crack encrypted USB drives
description: TetrisPhantom targeted Asian governments in a "highly targeted" attack.

title: "Google has always been known as the AI company - and generative AI is really giving us the opportunity to shine" - Google Cloud VP tells us why it will be the power behind your company’s AI future
description: A "decade-long head start" helps, but now it’s time to prove AI leadership, Google Cloud VP says.

title: Marvel's superheroes are about to come to Magic: The Gathering in a big way
description: Marvel is coming to Magic: The Gathering thanks to a new multi-year, multi-set deal between Marvel and Hasbro.

title: Meet Japan's bright new idea for boosting EV range – wireless charging at traffic lights
description: Researchers in Japan are trialling wireless EV charging technology at traffic lights

title: Your friends can dunk on your dating choices a lot easier with this new Tinder feature
description: Test how well your friends know your taste with Tinder’s matchmaker feature.

title: Brave browser under fire for installing its VPN without user permission
description: Shady VPN installations shed new light on Brave's approach to transparency. Here's what we know so far.

title: Bad news - these fake LinkedIn job offers are just pushing malware, so don't get your hopes up
description: No, you're not Corsair's next social media manager, but you might get your data stolen.

title: Marvel’s Spider-Man 2 is officially the fastest-selling PlayStation Studios game ever
description: Marvel's Spider-Man 2 sold over 2.5 million copies in the first 24 hours after its launch, making it the fastest-selling PlayStation Studios game of all time.

title: Ransomware is threatening more businesses than ever before
description: Hackers are exploiting sloppy migration from on-prem to the cloud to deploy ransomware and wreak havoc.

title: Cyberbunker: The Criminal Underworld is the mysterious hacker Netflix series I didn’t know I wanted
description: I hope the trailer for Netflix’s Cyberbunker: The Criminal Underworld series isn't setting me up for disappointment.

title: Construct and manage your own magic school in this simulation game published by Don’t Starve developer Klei
description: Mind Over Magic is a simulation game from Sparkypants that lets you build your own magical school, and a playtest is open now.

title: Nvidia RTX 4080 Super could fix one of the biggest complaints about the existing 4080
description: New leak suggests an inbound RTX 4080 Super might be the 4080 that PC gamers wanted in the first place.

title: Okta could be facing more cyberattacks following customer support hack
description: A hacker obtained browser session cookies for Okta customers and tried to use them to compromise a network.

title: Full DJI Pocket 3 specs leak, and it's a much bigger upgrade than we thought
description: Some massive DJI Pocket 3 leaks have revealed almost everything about the imminent vlogging camera – except its price.

title: Amazon will now fire employees who don't come into the office
description: Workers failing to comply with Amazon’s RTO policy may risk losing their jobs or other disciplinary action.

title: Windows 11’s final major update before Windows 12 could drop soon – and here’s what it will look like
description: Windows 11 23H2 update introduces new features, enhances support for software, and paves the way for Microsoft's anticipated 'Windows 12' release.

title: Samsung Galaxy S24 leaks point to design changes and more AI than the Pixel 8
description: Samsung apparently wants to outdo Google when it comes to packing artificial intelligence into phones.

title: This new Chrome feature may protect your privacy in a big way
description: Google Chrome isn’t known for its privacy chops, but an upcoming feature could help change that.

title: Hackers breached the International Criminal Court in cyber espionage attack
description: The ICC has released more details surrounding suspected cyberattack.

title: Windows Phone has one last laugh by letting users bypass YouTube’s ad blocker
description: An user-agent tool can be used to select Windows Phone in Chrome to bypass annoying YouTube popups.

title: Slack might have just added its most bizarre feature yet - but some of you will love it
description: More "tracks" and sounds coming to the Slack Huddles jukebox, if you're in the mood for a sound bath.

title: PlayStation has been hit with a round of layoffs, former employees reveal
description: Some former PlayStation employees have revealed that the company has been hit with a round of layoffs.

title: The Black Book is like a grittier John Wick and it’s a smash hit on Netflix
description: Nollywood’s first global Netflix no. 1 hit – The Black Book – is a thrilling watch that's similar to John Wick.

title: Much of Europe is falling behind on offering high-speed connectivity
description: Ookla study finds Europe isn’t getting access to fast enough broadband, and those that do aren’t getting anywhere near what they should.

title: iPhone 16 could be more expensive than the iPhone 15 due to rising production costs
description: Increased iPhone 15 production costs suggest that Apple may be forced to charge more for the iPhone 16 line next year.

title: Apple rumors continue to confuse: new iMac could be imminent – and maybe a big surprise too?
description: One of the big-name Apple leakers has been spilling the gossip again, and theorizes an unlikely sound possibility.

description: Sony has dropped the soundtracks for a range of iconic titles, including Shadow of the Colossus, Wild Arms, and Gravity Rush.

title: The Star Citizen-based game, Squadron 42 is now feature-complete
description: Squadron-42 is now feature-complete, meaning we're nearly back to the Star Citizen universe.

title: Gmail will now let you read your work emails across a foldable phone screen
description: Gmail joins growing number of apps modified to better support tablet and foldable screens.

description: Apple reportedly plans “minor iPad refreshes” in March, with bigger upgrades coming later in 2024.

description: As we approach ChatGPT’s one-year public preview anniversary, workers are becoming more excited about GenAI.

description: This Mortal Kombat 1 mod replaces Kameo Fighter Cyrex with Freddy Fazbear from Five Nights at Freddy's.

title: Skull Island: Rise of Kong was apparently made in a year, which is why it looks so questionable
description: A new report about Skull Island: Rise of Kong suggests that developers were only given a year to bring the game to life.

title: Nintendo accounts will allow for a smoother transition to potential Switch successor
description: Nintendo aims to “help ease” transition to Switch Successor, says Nintendo of America president Doug Bowser.

title: Dev who swapped his game with image of Goatse to troll sites that stole it says it's one of his "greatest achievements"
description: Sqword developer Josh C. Simmons did the responsible thing in response to websites monetizing his free game.
